intro: Parrya villosula, commonly known as the hairy parrya, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Polygonaceae. It is a perennial herb characterized by its slender, upright stems and small, lance-shaped leaves that are covered in fine, hairy glands. The plant produces clusters of tiny, greenish-white flowers during the spring and early summer. It is native to the western United States, particularly in regions with moist, shaded habitats. Parrya villosula is often found in forest understories and is adapted to thrive in cool, humid environments.
